text: this apple tart is a bit of a departure
from the traditional it has a super
tasty layer of pink apple sauce in the
bottom then an artful array of fanned
apple slices on top and if that weren't
enough a glaze made from red currant
jelly and Calvados so I already have my
baked and cooled tart shell ten inches
now to start on the filling quart a cup
of sugar into a small saucepan two
tablespoons of butter and a pinch of
salt I'm going to bring this over to the
stove and add my apple sauce and get
going okay I have my stuff at the stove
I'm going to turn it on to about
medium-high and cook this take about
three minutes to get the butter melted
and the sugar dissolved okay to this I'm
going to add a tablespoon of Calvados
which is a really delicious brandy
do it slowly because it will spatter up
there we go
stir that in and then a cup and a half
of apple sauce and look at this gorgeous
pink apple sauce so pretty this is gonna
be the base of our tart once it's all
combined and warm I'll bring it back
over to my tart shell so I'm gonna pour
it into the tart shell make sure the
tart shell is completely cool before you
add the apple sauce filling it's so
pretty already
okay spread this out beautiful now for
the apples on top so I have two apples
here when you use an apple corer to
remove the inside
okay now I have my mandolin and I want
very very thin slices pretty much
paper-thin so let's see where we are
these are a little bit thick I'm in just
the mandolin
okay those are pretty nice I think
that's pretty good so slice down these
two apples and the other one so now for
the layering I'm gonna start in the
middle and work out so put these down a
nice fan tuck some under just work your
way all the way around the tart can use
these smaller ones down here okay that
looks beautiful so this goes into a 400
tricky oven just until the apples are
crisp tender about 15 minutes so to make
our glaze for the beautiful tart we need
three tablespoons of a red currant jelly
or really any bright red jelly will
would be nice as sour cherry could work
here raspberry jelly anything that goes
nicely with apples so three tablespoons
plus one tablespoon of the Calvados
medium heat just want to warm this melt
the jelly combine this so that it can
brush on to the top of the tart it's
about three minutes over medium heat
okay this looks good it's ready to brush
onto the tart our tart is finished it is
perfectly cooled everything looks
gorgeous the apples are tender so now
the glazing this is going to add some
really nice flavor and a beautiful shine
to the top of the apples gives it a
little bit of a pink hue too which is
nice okay so once the glaze has a chance
to cool slide
and set it'll be ready to slice and
trust me this heart is as good as it
